titleStmt.title: Henry K. Steele to James F. Robinson
CWG12173

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: 1st - 20th Regiments Kentucky Infantry Primary Source Documents

body.p:
Medical Directors Office Qr Division
Army of Ky. Lexington Dec 31s 1862
Sir

I have the honor to call your attention to the State of the Medical department in the Kentucky regiments, attached to this division, (being the 18th at this place and the 24th at Frankfort). There has never yet been assigned to them, the Qr Asst Surgeon which they were entitled to by General orders No 79 War Department. Asst Surgeon M. E. Poynter of 24th has resigned, and asst Surgeon J. C. Elliott 18th has been detached to Hospital No 2 Lexington Ky, leaving each of them with only one medical officer. I therefore beg leave to urge the necessity of filling up these vacancies soon as possible.

I am Sir
Very Respectfully
Your Obedient Serv.
Henry K Steele Surg 44 Reg O V I
Med Director 2nd Div Army Ky

His Honor
Jas F Robinson
Governor Commonwealth Kentucky
Frankfort --

18
Med. Dir. office
Lex. Ky. Dec 21st 1862.
Steele H. K.
Med. Dir.
Vacancies in Med. Staff of 18th Ky. and 24th Ky.
